definitions.definition: To remain suspended in air, water etc.; to float, to hover.
To wait, linger.
To move on or by.
To remain; delay.
To remain stationary (usually on horseback).
To raise; lift; hold up.
To rise.
To lift with difficulty; to raise with some effort; to lift (a heavy thing).
definitions.example: We heaved the chest-of-drawers on to the second-floor landing.

definitions.definition: To throw, cast.
definitions.example: The cap'n hove the body overboard.

definitions.definition: To rise and fall.
To utter with effort.
definitions.example: She heaved a sigh and stared out of the window.

definitions.definition: To pull up with a rope or cable.
definitions.example: Heave up the anchor there, boys!

definitions.definition: To lift (generally); to raise, or cause to move upwards (particularly in ships or vehicles) or forwards.
To be thrown up or raised; to rise upward, as a tower or mound.
To displace (a vein, stratum).
To cause to swell or rise, especially in repeated exertions.
To move in a certain direction or into a certain position or situation.
To retch, to make an effort to vomit; to vomit.
definitions.example: The smell of the old cheese was enough to make you heave.

definitions.definition: To make an effort to raise, throw, or move anything; to strain to do something difficult.
To rob; to steal from; to plunder.
